supersolids.tools.cut_1d¶

Animation for the numerical solver for the non-linear time-dependent Schrodinger equation.

Module Contents¶

Functions¶

cut_1d(System: supersolids.Schroedinger.Schroedinger, slice_indices: numpy.ndarray = [0, 0, 0], psi_sol_3d_cut_x: Optional[Callable] = None, psi_sol_3d_cut_y: Optional[Callable] = None, psi_sol_3d_cut_z: Optional[Callable] = None, dir_path: pathlib.Path = Path(__file__).parent.parent.joinpath('results'), y_lim: Tuple[(float, float)] = (0.0, 1.0)) → None

Creates 1D plots of the probability function of the System \(|\psi|^2\)

prepare_cuts(func: Callable, N: int, alpha_z: float, e_dd: float, a_s_l_ho_ratio: float) → Optional[Callable]

Helper function to get \(R_r\) and \(R_z\) and set it for the given func.
supersolids.tools.cut_1d.cut_1d(System: supersolids.Schroedinger.Schroedinger, slice_indices: numpy.ndarray = [0, 0, 0], psi_sol_3d_cut_x: Optional[Callable] = None, psi_sol_3d_cut_y: Optional[Callable] = None, psi_sol_3d_cut_z: Optional[Callable] = None, dir_path: pathlib.Path = Path(__file__).parent.parent.joinpath('results'), y_lim: Tuple[float, float] = (0.0, 1.0)) → None[source]¶

Creates 1D plots of the probability function of the System \(|\psi|^2\) and if given of the solution.

Parameters

  • System – Schrödinger equations for the specified system

  • slice_indices – Numpy array with indices of grid points in the directions x, y, z (in terms of System.x, System.y, System.z) to produce a slice/plane in mayavi, where \(\psi_{prob}\) = \(|\psi|^2\) is used for the slice Max values is for e.g. System.Res.x - 1.

  • psi_sol_3d_cut_x – 1D function after cut in x direction.

  • psi_sol_3d_cut_y – 1D function after cut in y direction.

  • psi_sol_3d_cut_z – 1D function after cut in z direction.

  • dir_path – Path where to save 1d cut plots

  • y_lim – Limit of y for plotting the 1D cut

supersolids.tools.cut_1d.prepare_cuts(func: Callable, N: int, alpha_z: float, e_dd: float, a_s_l_ho_ratio: float) → Optional[Callable][source]¶

Helper function to get \(R_r\) and \(R_z\) and set it for the given func.

Parameters

  • func – Function to take cuts from

  • N – Number of particles

  • alpha_z – Ratio between z and x frequencies of the trap \(w_{z} / w_{x}\)

  • e_dd – Factor \(\epsilon_{dd} = a_{dd} / a_{s}\)

  • a_s_l_ho_ratio – \(a_s\) in units of \(l_{HO}\)

Returns

func with fixed \(R_r\) and \(R_z\) (zeros of \(func_{125}\)), if no singularity occurs, else None.
